title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 53.9 - Changes in approval requirements
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 53.9 - Changes in approval requirements

State Regulations

The Commissioner of Motor Vehicles at his discretion
reserves the right to alter or change the requirements or specifications or to
require additional or supplementary tests at any time. The commissioner further
reserves the right to require the manufacturer to furnish without charge a
reasonable number of samples selected by the commissioner from manufacturer's, distributor's or retailer's stocks for verification of test reports. The cost
of verification tests shall be borne by the manufacturer. If any such report
discloses any unapprovable deviation from the standards on which the approval
was based, the commissioner may, upon due notice to the manufacturer, revoke
the approval. Approval may be withdrawn at any time and for any cause deemed
reasonable by the commissioner, or the commissioner may require new approvals
at any time he deems necessary or reasonable. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15
ยง
53.9

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
